sec.p: Lavandula angustifolia Mill. is one of the most famous aromatic and medicinal plants [ 351] used in fresh state or dry condition, containing 1â€“6% volatile oils (monoterpenic compounds, alcohols, and esters), triterpenic acids, coumarins, flavones, resins, and polyphenols [ 352]. As medicinal activity, L. angustifolia extracts or essential oils possess antispastic, carminative, analgesic, sedative, hypotensive, antiseptic, antimicrobial, antifungic, diuretic, and general tonic action, but little information on lavender analgesic properties is available in the literature.
